event: Charlotte City Council adds LGBT protections to the city's nondiscrimination orfinance, granting protection in places of "public accomodation."
N.C. House Speaker Tim Moore calls for legislative action, focusing on "the bathrooom piece" of Charlotte's ordinance.
Agaisnt the wishes of N.C. Gov. Pat McCrory, lawmakers call a special session to discuss the ordinance.
The N.C. General Assembly passes HB2 - the "bathroom bill." McCrory signs it into law that night.
The American Civil Liberties Union and other parties file a lawsuit asking the courts to overturn HB2, challending the law's constitutionality.
Amid pressure, McCrory signs an executive order preventing state employees from being fired or disciplined for being gay or transgender.
Bruce Springsteen canceled his show in Greensboro, N.C.
Pearl Jam canceled their Raleigh, N.C.  Show.
Cirque du Soleil canceled their Greensboro and Charlotte shows.
Stephen Schwartz said he will no longer allow his musicals, which include top-hit "Wicked," sto be performed in N.C.
Lionsgate moved the location of their upcoming tv show production set from Charlotte to Canada.
